citation.article-title: Proposals of Sphingomonas paucimobilis gen. nov. and comb. nov., Sphingomonas parapaucimobilis sp. nov., Sphingomonas yanoikuyae sp. nov., Sphingomonas adhaesiva sp. nov., Sphingomonas capsulata comb. nov., and two genospecies of the genus Sphingomonas.

p.s: (sphin. go. monas, Gr. adj. shingos of spinx; Gr. n. monas a unit, monad; M.L. fem. n. Shingomonas a shingosine-containing monad)
The cells of species in this genus are Gram-negative, nonsporeforrning, straight rods that have a single polar flagellum when motile.
With one exceptional species, colonies are definitely lemon-yellow from the beginning of their appearance.
Acid produced oxidatively from pentoses, hexoses, disacchrides, but not polyalcohols and inulin.
Major fatty acids of cellular lipid are cis-octadecenoic and 2-hydroxymyristic.
Its major long-chain bases are d-18:0, d-20-1, and d-21-1 (59, 11, and 12%, respectively in type strain of S. paucimobilis), sugar moiety is glucuronic acid, and fatty acid is 2-hydroxymyristic.
Probably distribute widely n natural and artificial environments.
Some are opportunistically pathogenic for humans.
The nucleotide of 16S rRNA at the position 1290 (in Escherichia coli) is deleted.
Type species is Sphingomonas paucimobilis (Holmes et al) comb. nov.
